thread.section_title: Business News, Economy, Finance & ASX Market News
thread.title: Market Wrap: Yields tighten as investors snap up properties
thread.title_full: Market Wrap: Yields tighten as investors snap up properties

author: The Sydney Morning Herald
title: Market Wrap: Yields tighten as investors snap up properties
text:
A local investor purchased this two-level office on a high exposure corner site in Malvern for $3.67 million. Photo: Supplied
SALES
Malvern
A local investor snapped up a two level office building on a high-exposure corner site at 242-246 Glenferrie Road for $3.67 million. GormanKelly's Chris Alcock and David Minton said three bidders pushed the price about 36 per cent above the reserve, reflecting a low yield of 2.57 per cent. The property was leased to long standing tenant Liston Landers with an annual return of $94,327 per annum.
The tenant, a veterinary surgeon, purchased this North Balwyn property. Photo: Supplied
CBD
Advertisement Lendlease has offloaded a 251 square metre shop on the ground floor of its upmarket EXO apartment tower at 852 Collins Street. Colliers International's Daniel Wolman and Oliver Hay , who handled the deal, said the store sold before auction for $2.51 million on a yield of 6.27 per cent. Flight Centre has a ten-year lease on the premises. Mr Hay said there was a growing appetite for the Victoria Harbour assets as investors became aware of the area's potential for growth.
Hawthorn East
A single-storey, 120 square metre shop at 604 Burwood Road sold with vacant possession, Gross Waddell's Benjamin Klein and Alex Ham said. The shop located in Auburn Village shopping centre went for $917,000. "The auction attracted 40 people approximately with four bidders competing for the property which was eventually sold to a local investor," Mr Klein said.
Camberwell
A prominent offshore group has fought off stiff competition to buy three residential properties in one line in sought-after Burke Road. Three neighbouring landowners clubbed together to form a 2787-sqm development site at 585-589 Burke Road which was sold for about $10 million by CBRE's Scott Orchard, Julian White , David Minty and Lewis Tong . "It has reaped the landowners a financial premium more than 25 percent above what they could have achieved by selling their sites individually," Mr White said.
West Melbourne
A property that was last sold in 1973 for $73,000 fell under the hammer at auction for $2,405,000. The two-level office/warehouse at 88 Miller Street achieved a rate of almost $7700 per square metre, a record for a small West Melbourne warehouse, W. B. Simpson & Son auctioneer Richard Simpson said. The 1960s brick warehouse was purchased by a local businessman who plans to convert it into residential.
Hallam
Cameron Industrial Commercial's Al Armstrong and Angus Clark have sold 11S Young Road in a hotly contested auction. The prominent 4282-square-metre parcel of land zoned "general residential 1" went for $2,675,000.
North Balwyn
A local investor/ developer and a tenant outbid rivals in two hotly contested auctions setting CBD-like yields of just 1.49 and 2.89 per cent and exceeding the vendor's expectations by a combined $500,000. Six bidders drove the price of 341 Balwyn Road to $935,000 and five bidders pushed 339 Balwyn Road to $790,000, said Teska Carson's George Takis and Michael Taylor . Number 339 sold to an investor/developer and the veterinary surgeon tenant purchased 341.
LEASES
Hawksburn
Gross Waddell's Tamara Gross has leased 578 Malvern Road in an off-market deal. The 90-square-metre ground floor of the newly redeveloped building was leased to Morrison Clothing on a 5 + 5 year lease for $90,000 per annum net plus GST. Morrison also took the second floor apartment for $45,000 per annum to use as a wholesale showroom. Another residence is on the third level. The store will open this month.
Wantirna South
Employment agencies Reed Employment and SYC have leased office space at 420 Burwood Highway. Reed took 280 square metres on a 2 + 5 year term and SYC has leased 176 square metres on a 5 + 5 year term. The rent was undisclosed but it's believed to be between $230-$260 net. JLL's Nat Meredith said 420 Burwood Highway was now fully leased. In another deal, Ms Meredith leased Landmark Construction 211 square metres at 1020 Doncaster Road on a term of 3 x 3 years with rent reported to be $54,000 net.
Camberwell
Hello World Travel has leased 1000 square metres at 2-6 Railway Parade for $325 per sqm net in a suburban A-Grade office building located in the heart of Camberwell Junction, JLL's Josh Tebb said. Helloworld will run a call centre from the site.
Melbourne
BMF Constructions has moved into 60 Albert Road following landlord Domain Centre's willingness to carve up the building's floor plates. The group took 162 sqm on Level 11 at $390 per sqm gross face rent on a five-year term in a deal negotiate by Colliers International's Vincent Tran . Mr Tran also negotiated Time Target taking 157 sqm on Level 1 of VALAD Property Group's building at 636 St Kilda Road on Net Face Rent Between $310-$350/sqm.
Submissions to sjohanson@fairfaxmedia.com.au
